name: Avocado Toast
instructions: 1. Slice the avocado in half and remove the pit. Scoop out the avocado flesh and mash it with a fork. 2. Toast the bread until it is crispy. 3. Spread the mashed avocado on top of the toast. 4. Squeeze the lemon juice over the avocado and sprinkle with salt and pepper. 5. Enjoy immediately.

name: Grilled Vegetable Skewers
instructions: 1. Preheat the grill to medium-high heat. 2. Cut the zucchini, squash, bell peppers, and onion into 1-inch pieces. Thread the vegetables onto skewers, alternating between the different types. 3. Brush the skewers with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper. 4. Grill the skewers for 8-10 minutes, turning occasionally, until the vegetables are tender and lightly charred. 5. Serve the skewers hot off the grill.

name: Shrimp and Asparagus Stir-Fry
instructions: 1. Heat a wok or large frying pan over high heat. 2. Add the shrimp and cook for 2-3 minutes, or until pink and opaque. Remove the shrimp from the pan and set aside. 3. Add the asparagus to the pan and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes, or until tender. 4. In a small bowl, whisk together the garlic, ginger, soy sauce, rice vinegar, sesame oil, and red pepper flakes. 5. Add the sauce to the pan with the asparagus and stir to coat. 6. Add the cooked shrimp back into the pan and stir to combine. 7. Serve the stir-fry hot over rice or noodles.

name: Quinoa and Black Bean Salad
instructions: 1. Cook the quinoa according to package instructions. 2. Drain and rinse the black beans. 3. Chop the tomato and red onion into small pieces. Chop the cilantro. 4. In a large bowl, combine the cooked quinoa, black beans, tomato, red onion, and cilantro. 5. In a small bowl, whisk together the lime juice, olive oil, cumin, and salt. 6. Pour the dressing over the quinoa mixture and stir to coat. 7. Serve the salad cold or at room temperature.

name: Turkey Lettuce Wraps
instructions: 1. In a large frying pan, cook the ground turkey over medium-high heat until it is browned and fully cooked. 2. While the turkey is cooking, chop the bell pepper, carrots, and green onions. 3. Once the turkey is cooked, add the bell pepper, carrots, and green onions to the pan. Stir in the hoisin sauce. 4. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender. 5. Divide the turkey mixture among the lettuce leaves. 6. Top each wrap with a sprinkle of peanuts. 7. Serve the wraps immediately.

name: Spaghetti Squash with Tomato Sauce
instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C). 2. Cut the spaghetti squash in half lengthwise and scoop out the seeds. 3. Place the squash halves cut-side down on a baking sheet. Bake for 30-40 minutes, or until the squash is tender. 4. While the squash is cooking, cook the ground turkey in a large frying pan over medium-high heat until it is browned and fully cooked. 5. Stir in the tomato sauce and simmer for 5 minutes. 6. Once the squash is cooked, use a fork to scrape the strands of squash into a large bowl. 7. Add the sauce and ground turkey to the bowl with the spaghetti squash and toss to combine. 8. Top with fresh basil and grated parmesan cheese. 9. Serve the spaghetti squash hot.

name: Grilled Salmon with Lemon and Herbs

ingredients.name: Fresh herbs (such as parsley, dill, or basil)

instructions: 1. Preheat the grill to medium-high heat (around 400°F/200°C). 2. Rinse the salmon fillets and pat them dry with paper towels. 3. Finely chop the fresh herbs. Zest the lemon and then cut it into wedges. 4. In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, salt, pepper, and lemon zest. 5. Place the salmon fillets on a large plate or tray. Brush both sides of the fillets with the olive oil mixture. 6. Place the salmon fillets on the grill and cook for 4-5 minutes on each side, or until the fish is cooked to your desired level of doneness. 7. Remove the salmon from the grill and top with the fresh herbs. Serve the salmon hot with the lemon wedges on the side.

name: Shrimp and Vegetable Stir-Fry
instructions: 1. Rinse the shrimp and pat them dry with paper towels. Chop the broccoli, bell pepper, carrots, and snow peas into bite-sized pieces. 2. In a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, rice vinegar, sesame oil, garlic, ginger, cornstarch, and water. 3. Heat a large frying pan or wok over high heat. Add the vegetables to the pan and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes, or until they are tender. 4. Add the shrimp to the pan and stir-fry for an additional 2-3 minutes, or until the shrimp are pink and fully cooked. 5. Stir in the sauce and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened. 6. Serve the stir-fry hot over rice or noodles.

name: Cauliflower Fried Rice
instructions: 1. Cut the cauliflower into small florets and pulse them in a food processor until they are the size of grains of rice. 2. Beat the eggs in a small bowl. 3. Heat a large frying pan or wok over medium heat. Add the eggs to the pan and scramble them until they are fully cooked. 4. Remove the eggs from the pan and set them aside. 5. In the same pan, add the cauliflower, peas, carrots, green onions, soy sauce, sesame oil, garlic, and ginger. Stir-fry for 5-6 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender. 6. Stir in the cooked eggs and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes, or until everything is heated through. 7. Serve the cauliflower fried rice hot.
